<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Our dataset is now without duplicates and missing data.</p>
<h3 id="Display-correlation-between-variables">Display correlation between variables<a class="anchor-link" href="#Display-correlation-between-variables">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numeric_only</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>bmi</th>
      <th>children</th>
      <th>charges</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>age</th>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.109344</td>
      <td>0.041536</td>
      <td>0.298308</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>bmi</th>
      <td>0.109344</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.012755</td>
      <td>0.198401</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>children</th>
      <td>0.041536</td>
      <td>0.012755</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.067389</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>charges</th>
      <td>0.298308</td>
      <td>0.198401</td>
      <td>0.067389</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the Table we can see that there are no two variables with strong correlation. However, the correlation between <strong>charges</strong> and <strong>age</strong> which is about <strong>30%</strong> will need further inspection as it is trying to tell us something. Let us observe the corretion between <strong>charges</strong> and categorical variables.</p>
<p><strong>NB</strong>: We are comparing other variables to <strong>charges</strong> because <strong>charges</strong> has been choosen to be a dependent variable.</p>
<p>Let us display the distribution of charges as we may get some insights as to whether there are no attributes that are making our charges column to show weak correlation with other variables or not.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Plot a Histogram</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'charges'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The distribution is skewed to the right, an indication that there are more extremely high <strong>charges</strong> than they are extremely low charges. This has the ability of affecting how residual values are offseting each other. There is no balance. The expectation is for the residual values to cancel each other from both sides of the a regression line. Let us add a new column to our dataset. The new column will be the <strong>log</strong> of charges column. We will display the distribution of our new column and we will recalculate the correlation.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Add a log_charges column</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">numpy</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log2</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'charges'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the distribution of our new column</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hist</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a distribution that is almost <strong>normal</strong>. This distribution is more likely to produce less residual values than the previous one. Let us display the correlations now.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Correlation Table</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numeric_only</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>bmi</th>
      <th>children</th>
      <th>charges</th>
      <th>log_charges</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>age</th>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.109344</td>
      <td>0.041536</td>
      <td>0.298308</td>
      <td>0.526927</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>bmi</th>
      <td>0.109344</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.012755</td>
      <td>0.198401</td>
      <td>0.132822</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>children</th>
      <td>0.041536</td>
      <td>0.012755</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.067389</td>
      <td>0.160336</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>charges</th>
      <td>0.298308</td>
      <td>0.198401</td>
      <td>0.067389</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
      <td>0.893084</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>log_charges</th>
      <td>0.526927</td>
      <td>0.132822</td>
      <td>0.160336</td>
      <td>0.893084</td>
      <td>1.000000</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now see that correlation between <strong>log_charges</strong> and <strong>age</strong> (<strong>50%</strong>)is now higher than that of <strong>charges</strong> and <strong>age</strong>. We are going to use <strong>log_charges</strong> for our predictions.</p>
<p>Let us now check the correlation between the <strong>log_charges</strong> with categorical variables in our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Boxplot of log_charges and sex</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">column</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'sex'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There is a wider distribution of charges for <strong>male</strong> patients. However, we cannot explicitly tell the relationship between <strong>log_charges</strong> and <strong>sex</strong> columns.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># "log_charges" and "smoker"</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">column</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'smoker'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There is an explicit relationship between <strong>log_charges</strong> and <strong>smoker</strong>. It seems those who smoke are charged higher. We will use his column in our prediction.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># log_charges and region</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">column</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'region'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There is also no visisble relationship between <strong>log_charges</strong> and <strong>region</strong>,therefore we are not going to use this column.</p>
<p>Let us now <strong>feature engineer</strong> smoker column. The intention is to convert the variable make it suitable for regression analysis. We are going to convert <strong>yes</strong> to <strong>1</strong> and <strong>no</strong> to <strong>0</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Feature Engineering smoker column</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_dummies</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'smoker'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have introduced two new columns in our dataset: <strong>smoker_no</strong> and <strong>smoker_yes</strong>. We are going to use <strong>smoker_yes</strong> column.</p>
<p>Our model will consist of three variables from the dataset: <strong>log_charges</strong>, <strong>age</strong>, and <strong>smoker_yes</strong>.</p>
<h2 id="Dividing-the-dataset">Dividing the dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dividing-the-dataset">¶</a></h2><p>We will first divid our dataset into a <strong>target</strong> variable and <strong>feature</strong> variables.</p>
<p>Our target (dependent) variable is <strong>log_charges</strong> and the rest will be <strong>feature</strong> variables.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Target variable</span>
<span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># Feature variables</span>
<span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'log_charges'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Spliting-our-Dataset-into-Training-sets-and-Testing-sets">Spliting our Dataset into Training sets and Testing sets<a class="anchor-link" href="#Spliting-our-Dataset-into-Training-sets-and-Testing-sets">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Spliting data</span>
<span class="n">X_train</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_train</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">674</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the chape of our new datasets</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_train</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>(1069, 8)
(268, 8)
(1069,)
(268,)
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Creating-Subsets">Creating Subsets<a class="anchor-link" href="#Creating-Subsets">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># X_train subset</span>
<span class="n">X_train_subset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">X_train</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'age'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'smoker_yes'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="c1"># X_test subset</span>
<span class="n">X_test_subset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">X_test</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'age'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'smoker_yes'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the shape of subsets</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_subset</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_train_subset</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>(268, 2)
(1069, 2)
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Fitting-the-Model">Fitting the Model<a class="anchor-link" href="#Fitting-the-Model">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Instantiating the Linear Regression object</span>
<span class="n">model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LinearRegression</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># Fitting the model</span>
<span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_subset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_train</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now that we have our model, we can use it for making predictions. Before we use our model for prediction, let us display the estimated <strong>intercept</strong> and <strong>coefficients</strong> of our model.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Intercept</span>
<span class="n">intercept</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">intercept_</span>

<span class="c1"># coefficients</span>
<span class="n">coefficients</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">coef_</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"The Coeffients of our model are: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">coefficients</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"The Intercept for our model is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">intercept</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>The Coeffients of our model are: [0.04946947 2.2216724 ]
The Intercept for our model is: 10.757583699081843
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will not yet interpret the coefficients untill we run some test to make sure our model is a good model and ready for use. We will use <strong>R Squared</strong> goodness of fit measure.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># R_squared for Training data</span>
<span class="n">r_square_training_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_subset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_train</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># R_squared for Testing data</span>
<span class="n">r_square_testing_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_subset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y_test</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the R_squares scores</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r_square_training_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">r_square_testing_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sep</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>0.72193160925696
0.7997280587908229
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As determined by the <strong>Goodness of Fit</strong> (R Squares) above, our model is somewhat a good model to be used for prediction. However, our model may still need some touch up because we have only used two features as determinants of insurance charges while in real sense there are many variables determing insurance charges. There are also many Machine Learning models that can be used to predict insurance cost.</p>
<h3 id="Interpretation-of-Coefficients">Interpretation of Coefficients<a class="anchor-link" href="#Interpretation-of-Coefficients">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li>A one year increase in a patient's age results into <strong>5%</strong> increase in insurance charges.</li>
<li>If a patient is a smoker, his or her insurance charges will increase by <strong>822%</strong></li>
</ol>
<h2 id="Conclusion">Conclusion<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusion">¶</a></h2><p>We can go ahead and use the model for prediction. The above figures are supposed to be tested for significance, however, the main purpose of this project was to predict the model.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
 


<script type="text/javascript">if (!document.getElementById('mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#')) {
    var mathjaxscript = document.createElement('script');
    mathjaxscript.id = 'mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#';
    mathjaxscript.type = 'text/javascript';
    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>

entry.title: Exploring eBay Car Sales Data
entry.summary: This Project Demonstrates Proficiency in Data Cleaning, Feature Engineering, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Data Visualization using Matplotlib.
entry.content:

  margin: 0px;

div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;

  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;

  line-height: 1.21429em;

  -webkit-touch-callout: none;

  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;

  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;

  display: -webkit-box;

}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;

  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is

div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}

  background-color: transparent;

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with

 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;

}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

  color: #000;

  color: #333333;

}

  color: #008000;
}

  color: #f00;
}
.highlight-operator {
  color: #AA22FF;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
/* previously not defined, copying from default codemirror */
.highlight-def {
  color: #00f;
}

  color: #f50;
}
.highlight-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.highlight-bracket {
  color: #997;
}

}

  color: blue;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-quote {
  color: #090;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-link {
  color: #00c;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-error {
  color: #f00;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-tab {
  background: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAADAAAAAMCAYAAAAkuj5RAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAGFJREFUSMft1LsRQFAQheHPowAKoACx3IgEKtaEHujDjORSgWTH/ZOdnZOcM/sgk/kFFWY0qV8foQwS4MKBCS3qR6ixBJvElOobYAtivseIE120FaowJPN75GMu8j/LfMwNjh4HUpwg4LUAAAAASUVORK5CYII=);
  background-position: right;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;

  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;

  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */

  padding: 0;
}

/* raw_input styles */

</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Project-Overview">Project Overview<a class="anchor-link" href="#Project-Overview">¶</a></h2><p>This project will use a dataset of used cars from <em><strong>eBay Kleinanzeigen</strong></em>. eBay Kleinanzeigen is an online marketplace for classified <strong>ads</strong> that allow buyers and sellers to meet and connect locally. With roughly 30 million users a month, eBay Kleinanzeigen is one of the most important web services for online advertisements in Germany. On average, the company has more than 50 million advertisements listed across numerous second-hand good categories. The dataset is for <strong>ads</strong> on secondhand <strong>cars</strong> that were posted on their website between the years <strong>2015</strong> and <strong>2016</strong>.</p>
<h3 id="Aim:">Aim:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Aim:">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li>Data Cleaning.</li>
<li>Exploratory Data Analysis.</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="Questions:">Questions:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Questions:">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li>What are the popular car brands?</li>
<li>What is the most expensive car on average by brand?</li>
<li>How do car prices differ by odometer reading?</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="Importing-Python-Libraries">Importing Python Libraries<a class="anchor-link" href="#Importing-Python-Libraries">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># 1. Pandas for data manipulation and analysis</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">pandas</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">pd</span>

<span class="c1"># 2. Numpy for numerical data maipulation and analysis</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">numpy</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="c1"># 3. Pyplot module from Matplotlib for data visualisation</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">plt</span>

<span class="c1"># 4. Seaborn for data visualisation</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">seaborn</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">as</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">sns</span> 

<span class="c1"># 5. Visualisation Style</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">use</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'fivethirtyeight'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Suppress user warning</span>
<span class="kn">import</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">warnings</span>
<span class="n">warnings</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">filterwarnings</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">action</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'ignore'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Loading-the-Dataset-using-Pandas">Loading the Dataset using Pandas<a class="anchor-link" href="#Loading-the-Dataset-using-Pandas">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Read in dataset (csv file).</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"data/raw/autos.csv"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">low_memory</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the number of rows and columns. </span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[2]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(371539, 20)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The dataset has got <strong>371,539</strong> rows and <strong>20</strong> columns.</p>
<p>A set of <strong>50,000</strong> records will be randomly sampled from <strong>df</strong> dataset and be assigned to a variable named <strong>auto</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Random Sampling of 50,000 rows from "df"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">50000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the first five rows and first five columns from auto DataFrame</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The next step is to display some fundamental information of the <strong>auto</strong> dataset:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">

<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>

    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">shape</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"The Total number of Rows is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"The Total number of Columns is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>The Total number of Rows is: 50000

The Total number of Columns is: 20

</pre>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto_info</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'Non-Null Count'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">notnull</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="s1">'Dtype'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtypes</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="n">auto_info_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto_info</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto_info_df</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Observations:"><em>Observations:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#Observations:">¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>The dataset has got 50,000 rows ranging from <strong>0</strong> to <strong>49999</strong>.</li>
<li>There are 20 columns, most of which are strings.</li>
<li>Some columns have got <strong>missing</strong> values</li>
<li>Some columns have got data types that are not normal. For instance,  The expectation is for <em>dateCrawled</em> column to have <strong>datetime</strong> data type.</li>
<li>The column names use <strong>camelCase</strong> instead of python's preferred <strong>snakecase</strong>.</li>
<li>Some columns have got <strong>Germany</strong> worded values; values that are presented in Germany language.</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Data-Cleaning">Data Cleaning<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-Cleaning">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Cleaning-Column-Names">Cleaning Column Names<a class="anchor-link" href="#Cleaning-Column-Names">¶</a></h3><p>Let us convert the column names from <strong><em>camelCase</em></strong> to <strong><em>snakecase</em></strong> and change some of the column names so that they become more descriptive. We are also going to introduce an <strong>underscore</strong> into some column names to represent a space.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># camelCase to snakecase</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># renaming the some columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'yearofregistration'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'monthofregistration'</span><span class="p">:</span>\
                       <span class="s1">'registration_month'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'notrepaireddamage'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                       <span class="s1">'datecreated'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'nrofpictures'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                      <span class="s1">'kilometer'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Introducing an underscore in some columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'seller'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'offer_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'ab_test'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'vehicle_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'power_ps'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'model'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'registration_month'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'brand'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># Displaying column names to check if they have been successfully cleaned</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>Index(['date_crawled', 'name', 'seller', 'offer_type', 'price', 'ab_test',
       'vehicle_type', 'registration_year', 'gear_box', 'power_ps', 'model',
       'odometer', 'registration_month', 'fuel_type', 'brand',
       'unrepaired_damage', 'ad_created', 'number_of_pictures', 'postal_code',
       'last_seen'],
      dtype='object')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Checking-for-and-Removing-Duplicates">Checking for and Removing Duplicates<a class="anchor-link" href="#Checking-for-and-Removing-Duplicates">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to check for duplicate rows. If we have duplicate records we are going to remove them from our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Check for duplicate rows</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">duplicated</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>np.int64(2)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have <strong>2</strong> duplicate records as identified from the code above. We are going to remove them in the following exercise.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Remove duplicate rows</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop_duplicates</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display the number of remaining rows and columns</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[8]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(49998, 20)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We are remaining with <strong>49,998</strong> records and <strong>20</strong> columns after dropping duplicate rows.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Converting-Data-Types">Converting Data Types<a class="anchor-link" href="#Converting-Data-Types">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>We have columns with <strong>numeric</strong> data that has been stored as texts (<strong>strings</strong>).</li>
<li>There are columns with <strong>dates</strong> that are stored as texts.</li>
<li>We also have some columns where all or almost all values are the same. These can often be dropped as they do not have useful information.</li>
</ul>
<p>We can determine which columns to clean by exploring the data. We are about to make a quick exploration to determine which columns to clean further.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Checking data types</span>
<span class="n">d_types</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtypes</span>
<span class="n">d_types</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">d_types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">d_types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Column_Name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Data Type'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">d_types</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>odometer</code> is an <strong>object</strong> while it is supposed to be an <strong>integer</strong>. Let us convert it to an integer data type.</p>
<p>But first, we will find out what made python to recognise <code>odometer</code>as an object in the first place. This usually happens when there is a <strong>text</strong> value in an array of integers or floats.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">odometer_freq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">odometer</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">odometer_freq</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>odometer</th>
      <th>count</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>150000</td>
      <td>32453</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>125000</td>
      <td>5166</td>
    </tr>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The above output indicates that this <code>odometer</code> has a <strong>typo</strong> in the form of a <strong>date</strong> stored as a string. The value <em>30-03-16 00:44</em> is not supposed to be in this column. We are going to remove this record from the dataframe and convert the <code>odometer</code> to integer data type.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># removing a typo from the "odometer" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s1">'30-03-16 00:44'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># converting datatype to int64</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'int64'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># displaying the "odometer" data type</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtype</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>dtype('int64')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that <code>odometer</code>data type is now <strong>int64</strong> which is an integer.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>postal_code</code> is a float64 data type while it is supposed to be an object. Lets convert <code>postal_code</code>to an object.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># postal_code from float to an object</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'O'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># display 'postal_code' data type</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'postal_code'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtype</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[12]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>dtype('O')</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>postal_code</code>has successfuly been converted to an object data type.</p>
<p>Lets  now convert <code>date_crawled</code>, <code>ad_created</code>and <code>last_seen</code>to  <strong>datetime</strong> data types.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># convert "date_crawled" to datetime.</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'date_crawled'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># convert "ad_created" to datetime.</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ad_created'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># convert "last_seen" to datetime</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'last_seen'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># display data type for "date_crawled", "ad_created" and "last_seen"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"date_crawled"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"ad_created"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"last_seen"</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dtypes</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>date_crawled    datetime64[ns]
ad_created      datetime64[ns]
last_seen       datetime64[ns]
dtype: object</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that our date columns have successfully been converted to <strong>datetime64[ns]</strong></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It has also just come to our attention that odometer is lead in <strong>kilometers</strong>,  therefore we have to indicate that distance is measured in kilometers. We will convert <code>odometer</code> column name to <code>odometer_km</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># rename "odometer" to "odometer_km"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'odometer'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now that our dataset is <strong><em>Presumably</em></strong> clean, let us look at some <strong>descriptive statistics</strong>. These might as well uncover some areas that may need more cleaning or tell us which columns to remove from our dataset.</p>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Observation:"><em>Observation:</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#Observation:">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Column <code>seller</code> has one value "<em>privat</em>" with a frequency of <strong>49,997</strong> which is equal to total number of rows.</li>
<li>Column <code>offer_type</code>has one vale "<em>Angebot</em>" with a frequency of <strong>49, 997</strong>.</li>
<li>Columns <code>gear_box</code>, <code>fuel_type</code> and <code>unrepaired_damage</code> contain values that are in <strong>Germany</strong> words. These columns will require further exploration and, if need be, change Germany words to their corresponding English words.</li>
<li>Our dataset has got missing values. We are going to inspect the columns with missing values and come up with a better way for dealing with the missing values. That is whether to leave them as they are, replace them with other values, deleting rows with missing values or dropping columns with missing values.</li>
<li>Column <code>price</code> seems to have outliers. We will have to explore it further and deal will outliers accordingly.</li>
<li>Column <code>registration_year</code> has got strange values. We have a minimum value of <strong>1000</strong> and a maximum of <strong>9999</strong>, these are unrealistic values because in the year <strong>1000</strong> there were no cars yet and the year <strong>9999</strong> is in the future. We will explore this column further and make the necessary adjustments.</li>
<li>The dataset was <strong>crawled</strong> (pull from the website) in the year <strong>2016</strong> as indicated by the minimum <code>date_crawled</code> of <strong>2016-01-04</strong> and maximum <code>date_crawled</code> of <strong>2016-12-03</strong> this means we expect to have data for secondhand cars that were initially registered in the years before <strong>2016</strong>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="Dropping-Columns">Dropping Columns<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dropping-Columns">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to drop <code>seller</code>, <code>number_of_pictures</code> and <code>offer_type</code> because they have one <strong>unique</strong> value each, they are not necessary for our analysis.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Drop 'seller' and 'offer_type'</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'seller'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'offer_type'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'number_of_pictures'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(49997, 17)</pre>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>After dropping two columns we are remaing with <strong>17</strong> columns.</p>
<h3 id="Correcting-Missing-Values">Correcting Missing Values<a class="anchor-link" href="#Correcting-Missing-Values">¶</a></h3><p>We are going to find the number of missing values from every column and decide what to do with the missing values based on the nature of the values.</p>
<p>We will first find the number of <code>null</code> values in our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying the total number of missing values in our dataset</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Column Names'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Missing Values'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the look of things, we have <strong>5</strong> columns with missing values. All these columns are categorical in nature. We are going to replace all the missing values with <strong>"UnKnown"</strong>. The following are the columns with missing values:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>vehicle_type</code></li>
<li><code>gear_box</code></li>
<li><code>model</code></li>
<li><code>fuel_type</code></li>
<li><code>unrepaired_damage</code></li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Replace missing values with "UnKnown"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'UnKnown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Checking our dataset if we still have missing values</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isna</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Column Name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Missing Values'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">missing_values</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>
