<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a dataset without missing values as indicated in the above output.</p>
<h3 id="Cleaning-gear_box,-fuel_type-and-unrepaired_damage-columns">Cleaning <code>gear_box</code>, <code>fuel_type</code> and <code>unrepaired_damage</code> columns<a class="anchor-link" href="#Cleaning-gear_box,-fuel_type-and-unrepaired_damage-columns">¶</a></h3><p>These columns contain non English words. We will have to identify these words, find their English meaning and replace them with English words.</p>
<p>We will  start by exploring <code>gear_box</code> column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying unique values in "gear_box" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[21]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['manuell', 'automatik', 'UnKnown'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>gear_box</code> contains the following unique values <strong>manuell</strong>, <strong>automatik</strong> and <strong>Unknown</strong>. <strong>Manuell</strong> means <strong>Manual</strong> while <strong>automatik</strong> means <strong>Automatic</strong>. We are going replace the English words for Germany words.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "gear_box" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span>\
<span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'manuell'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Manual'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'automatik'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Automatic'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "gear_box" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gear_box'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[22]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['Manual', 'Automatic', 'UnKnown'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>gear_box</code>has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Let us explore <code>fuel_type</code> column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying "fuel_type" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[23]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['benzin', 'diesel', 'UnKnown', 'lpg', 'cng', 'andere', 'hybrid',
       'elektro'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In <code>fuel_type</code> column we are going to replace <strong>benzin</strong> with <strong><em><code>petrol</code></em></strong>, <strong>andere</strong> with <strong><em><code>others</code></em></strong> and <strong>elektro</strong> with <strong><em><code>electric</code></em></strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "fuel_type" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'benzin'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'petrol'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'andere'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'others'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'elektro'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'electric'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'UnKnown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'unknown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "fuel_type" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'fuel_type'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[24]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['petrol', 'diesel', 'unknown', 'lpg', 'cng', 'others', 'hybrid',
       'electric'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>fuel_type</code> has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Its time we explore <code>unrepaired_damage</code>column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Displaying "unrepaired_damage" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[25]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['nein', 'UnKnown', 'ja'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have <strong>nein</strong> for <strong><em>No</em></strong> and <strong>ja</strong> for <strong>Yes</strong>. Lets us replace these values accordingly.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Cleaning "unrepaired_damage" column</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span>\
<span class="nb">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'nein'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'No'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'ja'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Yes'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Display "unrepaired_damage" unique values</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'unrepaired_damage'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[26]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['No', 'UnKnown', 'Yes'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>unrepaired_damage</code> has successfully been cleaned.</p>
<p>Let us now clean <code>registration_year</code> column. This column has a value of <strong>1000</strong> as a minimum year of registration and <strong>9999</strong> as maximum year of registration. These values are unrealistic since in those years, cars were not have been invented and and it is in the future respectively. Let us explore the column, there might be other irregularities that could as well need our attention.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[27]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array([2007., 2001., 2011., 2000., 2013., 2005., 2002., 1996., 2004.,
       2018., 1993., 2008., 2006., 2012., 2014., 2003., 1997., 1995.,
       1994., 2010., 1998., 1999., 2016., 2009., 2017., 2015., 1971.,
       1987., 1992., 1990., 1985., 1978., 1967., 1989., 1986., 2019.,
       1980., 1982., 1991., 1951., 1968., 1983., 1950., 1988., 1973.,
       1956., 1969., 1960., 1979., 1976., 1984., 1957., 1961., 1910.,
       1965., 1977., 6000., 1972., 1962., 1000., 1974., 1958., 1970.,
       5555., 3200., 1300., 1975., 1966., 1981., 5911., 5000., 1955.,
       1964., 1939., 1933., 1963., 1953., 1400., 4800., 1600., 8455.,
       4100., 1943., 4000., 9000., 1954., 1947., 9999., 1959., 1920.,
       1936., 1952., 1800., 1929., 3000., 1932., 1111., 1938., 1946.])</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It seems the column has got many unrealistic values that need to be cleaned. There are some values that represent years before  cars were invented and values that represent years from the future. Since the first car was made in <strong>1886</strong> we are going to filter our data to include years from <strong>1886</strong> to <strong>2016</strong> the year our data was <strong>crawled</strong> from the website.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filtering our dataset to remove unrealistic years</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">1886</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">2016</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Verify if our column has been cleaned</span>
<span class="n">reg</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">reg</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Measure'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'registration_year'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Value'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">reg</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[28]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

        vertical-align: middle;
    }

        vertical-align: top;

      <th>Value</th>

  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>count</td>
      <td>48055.000000</td>
    </tr>

      <td>mean</td>
      <td>2002.814608</td>
    </tr>

      <th>2</th>

      <td>7.397660</td>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have successfully cleaned <code>registration_year</code> column. It now has a minimum year of <strong>1910</strong> and maximum year of <strong>2016</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Dealing-with-Outliers">Dealing with Outliers<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dealing-with-Outliers">¶</a></h3><p>The probable candidates for outliers in our datasets are columns <code>price</code> and <code>odometer_km</code>. Let us explore these two columns for outlier and decide how best we can deal with them.</p>
<p>We will use a <strong>boxplot</strong> for this activity.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Plotting a boxplot</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'fontfamily'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ticklabel_format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'x'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'plain'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price (US dollars)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">60000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100000000</span><span class="p">],</span>\
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'20,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'60,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
            <span class="s1">'80,000,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'100,000,000'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">rotation</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">45</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the <strong>BoxPlot</strong> we can see that <code>price</code> column has got outliers as some cars are indicated to be selling at a price of more than <strong>1, 000,000</strong> US dollars. There is even a car that is selling at a price of <strong>100, 000,000</strong> US dollars which is unrealistic. We also have cars which are priced at <strong>0.00</strong> which does not make sense. I do not think someone may place an <strong>ad</strong> for a car that does not have value.</p>
<p>Let us filter our dataset to include cars that are selling at a price of not more than <strong>100,000</strong> US dollars and exclude all cars with a price of less than <strong>500</strong> US dollars. We will plot the <strong>BoxPlot</strong> to display the changes.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filter our dataset</span>
<span class="n">auto</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">500</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">100000</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="c1"># Plot a boxplot</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontdict</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'fontfamily'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weight'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Price (US dollars)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">60000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">100000</span><span class="p">],</span> \
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'20,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'60,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'80,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'100,000'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
           <span class="n">fontfamily</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have outliers that can make sense. A price of <strong>100,000</strong> US dollars for a secondhand car is realistic.</p>
<p>Let us display some descriptive statistics for <code>price</code> column and see what we have about this column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">price</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Measure'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Value'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">price</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[31]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>Measure</th>
      <th>Value</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>count</td>
      <td>43326.000000</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>mean</td>
      <td>6232.335826</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>std</td>
      <td>7560.888729</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>3</th>
      <td>min</td>
      <td>500.000000</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>4</th>
      <td>25%</td>
      <td>1500.000000</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>5</th>
      <td>50%</td>
      <td>3500.000000</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>6</th>
      <td>75%</td>
      <td>7999.000000</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>7</th>
      <td>max</td>
      <td>99999.000000</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have a <code>price</code> column that is clean. The following are the basic statistics as displayed above:
    <code>minimum price</code> <strong>500</strong> dollars,
    <code>maximum price</code> <strong>99,999</strong> dollars,
    <code>medium price</code>  <strong>3, 500</strong> dollars, and 
    <code>mean price</code>    <strong>6,232</strong> dollars. 
The <strong>mean</strong> value is different from <strong>median</strong> value because it is affected by car prices of expencive cars. It seems many cars are priced in the range between <strong>1,500</strong> and <strong>7,999</strong> dollars, so prices of more than <strong>8,000</strong> dollars are offsetting the value of the mean. In this case a good measure of average price could be the <strong>Median</strong> as it is not affected by outliers.</p>
<p>Let us explore <code>odometer_km</code> for outliers now. We will still use a boxplot.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">boxplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">vert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Odometer_Km BoxPlot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Odometer Leading (Km)'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">40000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">80000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">120000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">160000</span><span class="p">],</span> \
           <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'40,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'80,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'120,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'160,000'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

>

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It shows that our <code>odomete_km</code> column does not have problems in as far as outliers are concerned. We have some cars with very little <strong>mileage</strong> and this is realistic even thought they have been presented in our boxplot. Let us display descriptive statistics for this column to get a wider perspective.</p>

<span class="n">odometer</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Measure'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'Value'</span><span class="p">})</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Our cleaned dataset has <strong>43326</strong> rows and <strong>18</strong> columns. This dataset is now ready to be used for <em>Data Analysis</em>.</p>
<p>This dataset can be exported for storage in <strong>csv</strong> format, excel's <strong>xslx</strong> formant or inserted as a table in a <strong>Relaional Database</strong>. We will continue our activity to conducting some Exploratory Data Analysis on our dataset.</p>
<h2 id="Data-Analysis">Data Analysis<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-Analysis">¶</a></h2><p>Questions to be Answered:</p>
<ol>
<li>What are the popular brands?</li>
<li>What are the most expensive cars by brand?</li>
<li>How do car prices differ by odometer readings?</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="Exploring-Brand-Popularity">Exploring Brand Popularity<a class="anchor-link" href="#Exploring-Brand-Popularity">¶</a></h3><p>Here we will try to answer the first question where we would like to find the top ten popular brands from our dataset.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [36]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Frequency table for "brand" column</span>
<span class="n">pop_brand</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'brand'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()[:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">pop_brand_table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pop_brand</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">pop_brand_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pop_brand_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">pop_brand_table</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[36]:</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the Frequency table above, we can easily see that <strong>volkswagen</strong> is the most popular brand with frequency of <strong>9238</strong>. We can display the results on a horizonatal bar plot.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [37]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Plotting a horizonatal barplot for the frequency table</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">pop_brand</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barh</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'brown'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labeltop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labelbottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">8000</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticklabels</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'4,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'8,000'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_yticklabels</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'Volkswagen'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'BMW'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Mercedes'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Opel'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                    <span class="s1">'Audi'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Ford'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Renault'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Peugeot'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Fiat'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Seat'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
                   <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Most Popular Brand'</span><span class="p">,</span> \
        <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">1.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Volkswagen is the most popular car brand'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
        <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'heavy'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">invert_yaxis</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the chart above, one may easily be able to detect which car brand is the most popular one. <strong>Volkswagen</strong> is the most popular car brand.</p>
<h3 id="Exploring-Price-by-Brand">Exploring Price by Brand<a class="anchor-link" href="#Exploring-Price-by-Brand">¶</a></h3><p>Let us now explore which brands asks a high price on average. We are also going to find the top ten most expensive brands.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [38]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">price_by_brand</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'brand'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)[:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">price_by_brand_table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">price_by_brand</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">price_by_brand_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">price_by_brand_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">price_by_brand_table</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[38]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>Brand</th>
      <th>Price</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>porsche</td>
      <td>34296.164557</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>land_rover</td>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the above table, on <strong>average</strong> the most expensive cars are the <strong>Porsche</strong> which are selling at an average price of <strong>34,296.16 US dollars</strong>. Following is a visualisation of the above findings.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [39]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">price_by_brand</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">barh</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticks</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">15000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30000</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticklabels</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'15,000'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'30,000'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_yticklabels</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'Porsche'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Land Rover'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Jeep'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Sonstige'</span><span class="p">,</span>\
                    <span class="s1">'Mini'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Jaguar'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Audi'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'BMW'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Mercedes'</span><span class="p">,</span> \
                    <span class="s1">'Chevrolet'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">6000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Average Price by Brand"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">1.5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Porsche is on average the most expensive brand"</span><span class="p">,</span>\
        <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'heavy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">invert_yaxis</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tick_params</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">labeltop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">labelbottom</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">visible</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Exploring-price-by-Mileage">Exploring price by Mileage<a class="anchor-link" href="#Exploring-price-by-Mileage">¶</a></h3><p>This is a market of secondhand cars and the expectation is that a car with a high mileage should fetch a lower price if compared to a car whose mileage is low, holding other factors constant. Cars are expected to depreciate in value as they are being used and one of the measures for indicating how much value the car has lost is mileage, the higher the mileage the lower the price. The <strong>auto</strong> dataset will be used to verify if the presumed assumption holds.</p>
<p>In this section, average car prices will be determined in relation to their mileage. The odometer readings will be grouped into three groups: <strong>50,000 Km</strong>, <strong>100,000 Km</strong> and <strong>150,000 Km</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [40]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># creating a new column "odometer_km_group"</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cut</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'(101666.667, 150000.0]'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'150,000 Km'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span>\
<span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'(53333.333, 101666.667]'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'100,000 Km'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'(4855.0, 53333.333]'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'50,000 Km'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">regex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[40]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['150,000 Km', '100,000 Km', '50,000 Km'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The new column <code>odemeter_km_group</code> has been created which will be used in the analysis.</p>
<p>The following is a calculation of average prices for every group in <code>odometer_km_group</code> column.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [41]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Create a groupby and calculate average prices</span>
<span class="n">mileage_group</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'odometer_km_group'</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">'price'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">mileage_group_table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mileage_group</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">mileage_group_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mileage_group_table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">mileage_group_table</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[41]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>Odometer_Km_Group</th>
      <th>Price</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>50,000 Km</td>
      <td>14651.190083</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>100,000 Km</td>
      <td>9633.555942</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>150,000 Km</td>
      <td>4426.330513</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The above output has verified the assumption that was made that cars with higher mileage are more likely to fetch a lower price on the market. In other words, the value of the car is inversely related to its odometer readings. The average price for cars with <strong>150,000 Km</strong> is lower than the average price of cars in the <strong>50,000 Km</strong> group.</p>
<p>The same results can still be presented on a <strong>donut</strong> chart.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [42]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Donut chart for average prices against odometer readings</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">mileage_group</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pie</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">colors</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'brown'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
                       <span class="n">wedgeprops</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'linewidth'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'edgecolor'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'#EEEEEE'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">startangle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rcParams</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'font.family'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rcParams</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'font.size'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">8</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_axis_off</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">my_circle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Circle</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="mf">0.7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'#EEEEEE'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">p</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">gcf</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">p</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">gca</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_artist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">my_circle</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.36</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Average Prices by Odometer Readings"</span><span class="p">,</span>\
        <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'bold'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Cars with Odometer readings of around 50,000 </span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">         </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="s2">kilometers are expensive on average"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'heavy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">size</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">family</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'serif'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Conclution">Conclution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclution">¶</a></h3><p>This marks the end of the project. The main purpose was to <strong>clean</strong> the data making it ready for Analysis. Some intial Explorary Data Analysis were also conducted to understand important relationships among columns and discriptive statistics.</p>
<p>The dataset will finally be exported as a <strong>csv file</strong> for storage in the local drive (Desktop) and will be assigned to variable <strong>auto_cars</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [43]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Export the dataset</span>
<span class="n">auto</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"data/clean/auto_cars.csv"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="THE-END">THE END<a class="anchor-link" href="#THE-END">¶</a></h1><h6 id="McBrown-Wilfred-Mwale">McBrown Wilfred Mwale<a class="anchor-link" href="#McBrown-Wilfred-Mwale">¶</a></h6>
</div>
</div>
</div>
 


<script type="text/javascript">if (!document.getElementById('mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#')) {
    var mathjaxscript = document.createElement('script');
    mathjaxscript.id = 'mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#';
    mathjaxscript.type = 'text/javascript';
    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>
